page.title: 03CHRISTENING IN COALISLAND
page.content: The first family celebration in our lives was our{Christening or Baptism. This is a religious ceremony where the newborn baby is admitted to the {Catholic Church.}The ceremony usually takes place two to three weeks after birth. The baby is dressed in a long white robe and wrapped in a shawl. He is brought to the church by his parents, godparents and other members of the family.Godparents are the people who make the promises that the baby will lead a good Christian life since he is too young to make them for himself. The priest baptises the baby with Holy Water and gives him his name. After the ceremony the family usually celebrate with a meal either in the baby's house or in an hotel.
